<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

When deploying a new Ceph cluster with Octopus image, the operation fails because of mon pod error.

$ kubectl -n rook-ceph get pods
```

NAME                                  READY   STATUS             RESTARTS   AGE
rook-ceph-agent-d88cc                 1/1     Running            0          7m4s
rook-ceph-agent-gvmls                 1/1     Running            0          7m4s
rook-ceph-mon-a-fcfd5554b-qtnh7       0/1     CrashLoopBackOff   6          6m3s
rook-ceph-operator-66b4b64569-54vt9   1/1     Running            0          7m14s
rook-discover-mzq55                   1/1     Running            0          7m4s
rook-discover-p8pcv                   1/1     Running            0          7m4s
```

$ kubectl -n rook-ceph describe pod rook-ceph-mon-a-fcfd5554b-qtnh7
```
< ... >
Init Containers:
  init-mon-fs:
    < ... >
      State:          Terminated
      Reason:       Completed
      Exit Code:    0
      Started:      Wed, 03 Jul 2019 06:45:55 +0000
      Finished:     Wed, 03 Jul 2019 06:45:55 +0000
    Ready:          True
    Restart Count: 1
< ... >
```

We can see init-mon-fs container was restarted. Log of second run:
```
debug 2019-07-03T06:45:55.761+0000 7f9e57519300 -1 '/var/lib/ceph/mon/ceph-a' already exists and is not empty: monitor may already exist
```

This does not help, try polling log for first run:
```
debug 2019-07-03T07:04:15.676+0000 7f702f558300  4 rocksdb: [/home/jenkins-build/build/workspace/ceph-dev-build/ARCH/x86_64/AVAILABLE_ARCH/x86_64/AVAILABLE_DIST/centos7/DIST/centos7/MACHINE_SIZE/huge/release/15.0.0-2298-g60403c0/rpm/el7/BUILD/ceph-15.0.0-2298-g60403c0/src/rocksdb/db/version_set.cc:3618] Column family [default] (ID 0), log number is 0

debug 2019-07-03T07:04:15.736+0000 7f702f558300  4 rocksdb: [/home/jenkins-build/build/workspace/ceph-dev-build/ARCH/x86_64/AVAILABLE_ARCH/x86_64/AVAILABLE_DIST/centos7/DIST/centos7/MACHINE_SIZE/huge/release/15.0.0-2298-g60403c0/rpm/el7/BUILD/ceph-15.0.0-2298-g60403c0/src/rocksdb/db/db_impl_open.cc:1287] DB pointer 0x56315a838000
debug 2019-07-03T07:04:15.740+0000 7f702f558300 -1 auth: error parsing file /etc/ceph/keyring-store/keyring: buffer::malformed_input: cannot parse buffer
debug 2019-07-03T07:04:15.740+0000 7f702f558300 -1 mon.a@-1(???) e0 unable to load initial keyring /etc/ceph/keyring-store/keyring
debug 2019-07-03T07:04:15.740+0000 7f702f558300 -1 ceph-mon: error creating monfs: (5) Input/output error
```

Look like there is an error when creating monmap.

Content of `/etc/ceph/keyring-store/keyring`:
```
[mon.]
	key = <...>
	caps mon = "allow *"


	[client.admin]
		key = <...>
		auid = 0
		caps mds = "allow *"
		caps mon = "allow *"
		caps osd = "allow *"
		caps mgr = "allow *"
```

Manually test this keyring with ceph-mon in Octopus, the command works if I removed the leading indention of `[client.admin]` section:

```
[mon.]
	key = <...>
	caps mon = "allow *"


[client.admin]
	key = <...>
	auid = 0
	caps mds = "allow *"
	caps mon = "allow *"
	caps osd = "allow *"
	caps mgr = "allow *"
```

It seems `ceph-mon` command in Octopus doesn't like those tabs in keyring file.

**Expected behavior:**

We should be able to provision a Ceph cluster with Octopus images.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
* For cluster, use a [ceph/daemon-base image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ceph/daemon-base/tags) which is built from Ceph master branch (currently Octopus release V15)
* For operator, use a Rook image with Octopus Ceph packages installed. (Doesn't really matter, since monmap is created in `init-mon-fs` init container of mon pod.)
* Follow [quickstart guide](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-quickstart.html) to bring up a Ceph cluster. After running `kubectl create -f cluster.yaml`, `ceph-rook-mon-a-xxx` pod is in error status.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): SLES 15 SP1
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux admin 4.12.14-195-default #1 SMP Tue May 7 10:55:11 UTC 2019 (8fba516) x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: local KVM VMs
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v1.0.2
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.14.1
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
title: Fail to deploy a Ceph cluster with Octopus image
